meanings.definition: To outwit or defeat by being more clever or cunning.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outmanoeuvre her opponent in the chess game.
meanings.sent2: The detective was able to outmanoeuvre the criminal and solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox was able to outmanoeuvre the hunter and escape into the forest.
meanings.sent4: With her quick thinking, she was able to outmanoeuvre the tricky situation and come out on top.
meanings.sent5: In order to outmanoeuvre her rival, she carefully planned her every move.

meanings.definition: To outsmart or outthink in a strategic or tactical situation.
meanings.sent1: The general was able to outmanoeuvre the enemy troops and secure victory.
meanings.sent2: He tried to outmanoeuvre his opponents by anticipating their next move.
meanings.sent3: The students tried to outmanoeuvre the teacher by hiding their cheat sheets.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, you need to outmanoeuvre your opponent to win.
meanings.sent5: The spy had to outmanoeuvre the security guards to access the classified information.
